main_definition: Not firmly or tightly fixed in place; detached or able to be separated from something else.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not tightly held together; free, unfastened, or not secured.
meanings_and_examples.example: The last button on my shirt came loose.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Slack, sloping, or slanting; lacking firmness in structure or support.
meanings_and_examples.example: His handwriting became loose over time due to arthritis.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not bound by strict rules or regulations; free from constraints.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has a very loose interpretation of the company's dress code policy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not tightly packed together, with space between objects or substances.
meanings_and_examples.example: The pile of leaves on the ground was loose and scattered.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unconstrained in movement; free to move about without restriction.
meanings_and_examples.example: During recess, children were allowed to play freely and their movements were not constrained by any rules.
